intro: Mesomelaena preissii, commonly known as the black-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family, and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, dark violet to black flowers that bloom in spring, adding a striking contrast to its dense, dark green foliage. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
